intro: Erysimum penyalarense, commonly known as the Azores wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Azores Islands. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It features basal and stem leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. Erysimum penyalarense is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
